intro: Saurauia isoxanthotricha, commonly known as the golden-stemmed saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Thailand, Vietnam, and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often as an understory plant. The bark and leaves have been traditionally used in local herbal medicine for their purported medicinal properties.
